alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 21 at 10:41PM PST until December 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... .The next round of precipitation will arrive by Wednesday afternoon and evening. Snow levels on Wednesday will generally be near or above 4000 feet. However, colder air will spread across the region Friday, with snow levels around 2500 to 3000 feet. Even lower snow levels along with additional precipitation is expected for the weekend across much of Northwest California. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with higher amounts in the Trinity Alps. * WHERE...Northern Trinity County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 1 PM Wednesday to 10 AM Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult over some mountain passes along Highway 3. Plan on slippery and potentially snow-covered roads, and carry chains. travel over Scott Mountain Summit could be very difficult to impossible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
